answers.answer: That is weird is it the 3 hours long test? I had the 3 hours test and they told me i should not eat anything 10 hours before the test
I didn't eat and I passed the 1 hour test. The glucose they give you has 50grams of sugar. So I wouldn't eat.
I didn't eat and I passed the 1 hour test. The glucose they give you has 50grams of sugar. So I wouldn't eat.
I was told to eat a high protein low carb diet the night before and 2 hours prior to drinking the glucose.
Dont eat anything  i had a peach doctor  told me i can eat anything  i end up having  it had to do the 3 hours  test fast girl !
Which turn out i didnt have it lol
If this is the 1 hour GD test, my doctor told me it was okay to eat something light beforehand such as crackers or a clear liquid.

By omitting carbs from your meal and having protein in your gut you are more likely to pass the test. This is because the glucose won't spike and drop your blood sugar so crazily with protein as a buffer.

My OB tod me that I can rat before my test but she also told ne not eat eat or drink anything sugary. As for drink I will stick with water that day and for food I will go for either a sandwich or scrambled eggs and a toast. The thing with me is that my sugar never goes up high it always stay low and I have a family history of diabetes.
I ate and my Ob made me wait a few hours to test. He told me not to eat before
My 1 hour they told me I could eat... and I think I did. I passed it with no problem. I have heard the 3 hour you aren't supposed to eat. If you are hungry, eat.

question: I have my gestational diabetes test on Tuesday, and it isn't until 2 o clock. My doctor told me I could eat before my appointment which is exactly the opposite of what I have always read or heard. I'm 28 weeks and have gained about 35 pounds so far with no history of family diabetes. Any experiences with this test from other mommies?
title: GD test on Tues. & Dr said it's ok to eat?!
